content: Currently, working as a research intern in Vision & Learning Lab at Seoul National University under the supervision of Prof. Gunhee Kim. My research interest is in computer vision, especially, object recognition in self and weakly supervised manners. I am also interested in representation learning as means to better understand weak supervision cases. Obtained my bachelor’s and master’s from UC Berkeley and UMass, Amherst, respectively. Joining Prof. Dougal Sutherland’s lab at the University of British Columbia from Fall 2020.

title: Wonho Bae

Rethinking Class Activations Mapping for Weakly Supervised Object Localization.
ECCV 2020.

Prediction of the Mortality Risk in Peritoneal Dialysis Patients using Machine Learning Models: A Nation-wide Prospective Cohort in Korea.
Scientific Report 2020.
Better to Follow, Follow to Be Better: Towards Precise Supervision of Feature Super-Resolution for Small Object Detection.  ICCV 2019.
